title: Romantic Lace! '80s Leather! H&M Studio's Holiday Drop Has 2025's Most-Anticipated Trends
text: (Image credit: H&M)The latest H&M Studio collection is here! The spring and fall collections from H&M's more edited, higher end-quality Studio line always sell out at the speed of light, and the capsule that just launched for the holiday season is already causing a fashion-person frenzy with dwindling stock just hours after it went live. I can't say I'm surprised in the least, though, because the collection might just be one of its most beautiful and forward-looking yet. It's filled with so many of the 2025 trends that our fashion team has been abuzz with since fashion month came to a close in October like romantic lace tops, menswear-inspired ties, and '80s leather jackets—all available today.H&M tapped model and It girl Amelia Gray to be the face of the collection and curate an edit of her favorite pieces, and her POV on holiday dressing leans heavily on tailored staples that wield the power to take you from the office to a chic cocktail party in seconds flat. "The overall vibe of this edit is very Amelia Gray," she told Who What Wear. One glance at her rack confirms this. Gray's edit mirrors her personal style to a T with iterations on the model-off-duty staples we regularly spot her in like relaxed trousers, bomber jackets, and a cool pair of flats. Ahead, discover Gray's edit and shop her favorite pieces, then further down peruse the rest of the Studio Collection.Shop Amelia Gray's H&M Studio Edit(Image credit: H&M)"This Matrix-like trench coat is a really good staple for a cocktail party. You could honestly just throw that on with with nothing else on underneath. Hello Kitty necklace, trench, and you're good to go." H&M Statement-Button Leather Coat H&M Slim Fit Pima Cotton Shirt H&M Pointed T-Strap Pumps (Image credit: H&M)"These pants with this bodysuit—I'm obsessed. This is for when I decide I don't want to stay in and have a cozy night but instead I'm going out and having a chic night." H&M Deep Plunge Lace Thong Body H&M Wool-Blend Tailored Trousers (Image credit: H&M)Walking us through her favorite pieces, Gray pulled out a leather jacket with '80s-inspired shawl collar that she says feels very her. "I'm a bomber-jacket girl, as you can tell. This is a big winter staple. I'm going to be wearing it a lot." H&M Leather Jacket With Shawl Collar H&M Straight Leather Pants More buy-worthy picks from the collection H&M Asymmetric Crêpe Dress H&M Bubble-Hem Off-The-Shoulder Top H&M Pleat-Detail Heeled Boots H&M Cropped Glittery Cardigan H&M Draped-Panel Shoulder-Pad Dress H&M Wool-Blend Tailored Trousers H&M Rhinestone-Ornament Hoop Earrings H&M Sheer-Skirt Maxi Dress H&M Grommet-Detail Leather Mini Shorts H&M Voluminous Crêpe Blouse H&M Statement-Button Reversible Cape H&M Wool-Blend Statement-Button Jacket H&M Wide Statement-Button Jeans Anna is an editor on the fashion team at Who What Wear and has been at the company for over five years, having begun her career in the Los Angeles office before relocating to New York, where she's currently based. Having always been passionate about pursuing a career in fashion, she built up her experience interning at the likes of Michael Kors, A.L.C., and College Fashionista before joining the team as a post-graduate assistant editor. Anna has penned a number of interviews with Who What Wear's cover stars over the years, including A-listers Megan Fox, Issa Rae, and Emma Chamberlain. She's earned a reputation for scouting new and emerging brands from across the globe and championing them to our audience of millions. While fashion is her main wheelhouse, Anna led the launch of WWW Travels last year, a new lifestyle vertical that highlights all things travel through a fashion-person lens. She is passionate about shopping vintage, whether it be at a favorite local outpost or an on-the-road discovery, and has amassed a wardrobe full of unique finds. When she's not writing, you can find her shooting street imagery on her film camera, attempting to learn a fourth or fifth language, or planning her next trip across the globe.
html:
The latest H&M Studio collection is here! The spring and fall collections from H&M's more edited, higher end-quality Studio line always sell out at the speed of light, and the capsule that just launched for the holiday season is already causing a fashion-person frenzy with dwindling stock just hours after it went live. I can't say I'm surprised in the least, though, because the collection might just be one of its most beautiful and forward-looking yet. It's filled with so many of the 2025 trends that our fashion team has been abuzz with since fashion month came to a close in October like romantic lace tops, menswear-inspired ties, and '80s leather jackets—all available today.

H&M tapped model and It girl Amelia Gray to be the face of the collection and curate an edit of her favorite pieces, and her POV on holiday dressing leans heavily on tailored staples that wield the power to take you from the office to a chic cocktail party in seconds flat. "The overall vibe of this edit is very Amelia Gray," she told Who What Wear. One glance at her rack confirms this. Gray's edit mirrors her personal style to a T with iterations on the model-off-duty staples we regularly spot her in like relaxed trousers, bomber jackets, and a cool pair of flats. Ahead, discover Gray's edit and shop her favorite pieces, then further down peruse the rest of the Studio Collection.

Shop Amelia Gray's H&M Studio Edit

"This Matrix-like trench coat is a really good staple for a cocktail party. You could honestly just throw that on with with nothing else on underneath. Hello Kitty necklace, trench, and you're good to go."

H&M

"These pants with this bodysuit—I'm obsessed. This is for when I decide I don't want to stay in and have a cozy night but instead I'm going out and having a chic night."

H&M

H&M

Wool-Blend Tailored Trousers

Walking us through her favorite pieces, Gray pulled out a leather jacket with '80s-inspired shawl collar that she says feels very her. "I'm a bomber-jacket girl, as you can tell. This is a big winter staple. I'm going to be wearing it a lot."

Anna is an editor on the fashion team at Who What Wear and has been at the company for over five years, having begun her career in the Los Angeles office before relocating to New York, where she's currently based. Having always been passionate about pursuing a career in fashion, she built up her experience interning at the likes of Michael Kors, A.L.C., and College Fashionista before joining the team as a post-graduate assistant editor. Anna has penned a number of interviews with Who What Wear's cover stars over the years, including A-listers Megan Fox, Issa Rae, and Emma Chamberlain. She's earned a reputation for scouting new and emerging brands from across the globe and championing them to our audience of millions. While fashion is her main wheelhouse, Anna led the launch of WWW Travels last year, a new lifestyle vertical that highlights all things travel through a fashion-person lens. She is passionate about shopping vintage, whether it be at a favorite local outpost or an on-the-road discovery, and has amassed a wardrobe full of unique finds. When she's not writing, you can find her shooting street imagery on her film camera, attempting to learn a fourth or fifth language, or planning her next trip across the globe.
